title: Sri Lanka military given shooting orders
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s military has been given orders to shoot those who are attacking public property, or causing personal harm, the Defence Ministry said as reports came about attacks on properties of ruling party officials for the second day.
Local media showed footage of a house in Malwana in flames and residents said a group of persons had attacked the residence of a government minister.
Police said 08 persons including a ruling party legislator, a mayor and two policemen had died in violence up to 0600 am on May 10.
Mobs attacked property of ruling party officials after a group of persons loyal to ex-Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa attacked a group of peaceful protestors in Colombo.
